author: mariapaulafn
content:
Hey sorry for being a party pooper - I'm an Argentinian too and could the name NOT be part of a Parisian Catholic Legend? Medalla Milagrosa, the station, is named after this legend based in Paris. the main church is actually in Paris. 
And why does the name have to be a catholic one? Ethereum should not represent religion imho. 
Independencia (freedom) is a station too - and it means Independence, there's so many other stations to pick that are not religious or not representative of Argentinian stuff. (Yes just popped by to say this because i didnt feel i should post it on Twitter)

author: mariapaulafn
content: I get it you gave it a special meaning, but religious imagery representation on Ethereum?

author: _0xuser
content: <@!483338031143845888> Medalla is fine. Someone is always going to be "offended" no matter the name you pick.

author: mariapaulafn
content: its not about offending. its not representative of Argentina

author: _0xuser
content: It was just about picking  a name

author: nocto4741
content: The idea is not to represent argentina, it's just the name of a metro station, nothing more, nothing less.

author: mariapaulafn
content: you want to pay an homage to my country, that makes me happy, but do it right - why the need to porrtray religious imagery, religion brings rifts

author: mariapaulafn
content: but thanks for explaining, i came to offer perspective - seems people are not open to it, thats fine

author: poojaranjan
content:
> and blockaction?
<@!557201004060213248> üëÄ

author: protolambda
content: <@483338031143845888> I appreciate your feedback. Everyone here has their opinion, don't take the words of a few as many. There's zero intention to make the name religious or political. It just happened to be something in the subway theme to correspond with a medal, I think. We'll think how we can improve it. The medal idea is particularly nice with the NFT work of other community members. Maybe <@411952680244740096> can comment

author: mariapaulafn
content: hey, <@!203220829473996800> i read his explanation, its super cool and witty, but the station refers to a catholic legend - medalla means literally medal but its not a station either, medalla milagrosa is, so i thought i could offer some historical/religious background before you label Ethereum as Catholic out of naivety üôÇ

author: paulhauner
content:
Well said <@203220829473996800>. I‚Äôm struggling to find English articles on ‚ÄúMedalla Milagrosa‚Äù, <@483338031143845888> could you please confirm this is an accurate translation?


https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miraculous_Medal

author: mariapaulafn
content: As a lot of Argentinians, my family is Catholic. At the same time, I feel religion is something from the past and that Ethereum unites people with a new kind of lingua franca, tech. Contrary to any religions. So "its just a station" actually, if people wonder why the name, wont stand imho. Anyways, just my two cents, names matter a lot and this is a huge milestone.

author: protolambda
content: The "medal" is also (intentional or not?) referencing Olympic testnet. Maybe we can think of some other name that builds on that?

author: paulhauner
content: No resistance to a name change on my end. The effort to make the change is trivial on the Lighthouse side.

content: Could we just drop the Milagrosa part?

content:
I don't feel great about coming here and annoying people, but im happy to contribute by checking historicals - in times of political unrest you sorta need to do this, people are rethinking history right now, its important Ethereum represents peace! 
I like Medalla alone, but that'd mean ditching the subway station name convention

author: worthalter
content: Drop milagrosa and we just do medalla please thank you

author: worthalter
content: We even registered medalla.eth (it has the NFT of each client on it already) a couple weeks ago, milagrosa wasn‚Äôt part of the plan.

author: worthalter
content: I didn‚Äôt know what the medalla milagrosa was until this week - I‚Äôm not religious. We never intended to make it a religious thing at all. It‚Äôs just a funny name of an utterly funny station if you been there. Also it‚Äôs the third worst ranking subway station of Buenos Aires (google maps user ratings) out of like over a hundred.

author: worthalter
content:
> i'm a line D maximalist and think line E is not the real subte
<@350513362423250945>  
There was a subtle pun on using an station name of the E line which is such an obscure line that most people never traveled in. Thanks Evan for triggering it üòÇ argentinians will freak out like: ‚Äúout of all the stations you had to use one of the E line‚Äù. The E line could disappear altogether and nobody would notice... aligned with the ephemeral existence of the medalla.testnet
